summary:
Energic, innovative, bottom-line impact-oriented finance professional with 17 years of experience in Business facing roles in the Energy industry (6 yrs Asset Finance, 7 yrs Projects Finance,1 yr Tax support on a project basis, 3½ yr Digitalisation/CI SME). Over the years I am recognized for my contributions by business stakeholders as well as supporting functions such as Project Control, Supply Chain and IMIT. At the moment I specifically focus on a portfolio of Digitalisation & CI (Continuous Improvement) projects within and outside Finance. I get energy from making a value impact and delivering upon continuous improvement projects enabled by Digitalisation.

I am enthusiastic, tenacious, a self-starter with a can-do mentality who is known to stimulate others regarding change management. A team-player searching for cross-functional collaborations to achieve the maximum joint value contributions to the business. Actively share knowledge / best practices with peers and across functions. Curious by nature I am always eager to learn about new innovations. 

When I am not working, I like to spend quality time with my wife and 2 daughters, family & friends. I love to be outside and cycle every day before the world awakes and still think windsurfing is the best sport there is. 

Always interested to meet new people from different backgrounds with a positive mindset. Send me a PM if you want to connect / cross-share knowledge.

profile_positions.description:
Throughout my career I always passionately work on the borders of Digitalisation, Finance, CI (Continuous Improvement) and the Business. I strongly believe a disciplined focus on the relation between Business Processes, Data, Systems and People has a major impact on a company's bottom-line. The focus areas of my current role.

Coach, drive several CI/digitalisation initiatives jointly with Finance Operations, CoE's, Business and IMIT e.g.: 
- Business Performance Management digitalisation: project lead of company wide initiative to align, simplify & digitalize monthly Management Information for all layers & asset teams in the organization
- Corporate cost reduction project: Agile squad member - reduce overheads while maximizing value impact of each service and optimize governance of associated processes
- Project Management Office squad member - improve & automate measuring success of Maintenance Execution and Pipeline integrity in an Agile @ scale company setup.
- E2E Touchless Project Reporting
- Fixed Asset reporting: automated, risk/value, exception based reporting
- Process Mining Analytics: discover E2E process improvements from scope initiation until invoice payment.

Asset Information Factory: lead the NAM Finance work stream in this ambitious global project connecting a wide variety of systems into 1 repository. Objective is to democratize insights from data enabling decision making/actions to make our business better, faster, simpler and more impactfull every day. Lead the global Shell Finance network to align prioritization and cross share best practices across countries.

Co-created a Digital curriculum framework for Global Finance Shell.

profile_positions.description:
Risk & Assurance: as coordinator of R&A process Groningen I have enabled the Asset Risk Response Committee to improve the quality of the process/discussions and influenced business stakeholders to include risk areas in the assurance plan.   

World Class Finance: strong drive to work effectively/efficiently with Finance Operations in Krakow & Chennai and appreciated for my role in their capacity building over the years. Experienced in migration of work as evidenced by my role in offshoring Project Finance- and Asset Finance activities. 

Clear understanding of business drivers, value, risk: as evidenced by coordination of 2017 Groningen Strategy review during uncertain period around Groningen future.

Driving digitalisation: member of NAM’s Data Analytics & Automation network, active participant in NAM’s Hackathons. Developed OPEX Management Information Proof of Concept which is used as input for a global Project and helped to accelerate the implementation of new technology enabling future touchless MI.
profile_positions.title: Finance Advisor Onshore Asset

profile_positions.description:
Seasoned Project Finance professional: developed a strong foundation of Project Finance skills during my 2 rotations of Project Finance roles (Offshore & Onshore portfolio’s). Provided Finance support for the Norg Expansion project (NAM’s 2nd largest project in history) which was delivered on time and within budget. 

Capital Expenditure focal point: investment proposal support/challenge and providing transparency in expenditure and investment choices during project review meetings. Ensured stakeholders were held accountable for their delivery of scope, forecasts vs. their Business plan- and internally/externally approved project target settings. Coordinated yearly business plan process for Projects. 

Improved the Project reporting process - internally & externally - jointly with cost control and co-created central Project tracking report which is still in use in NAM for Project tracking at all levels in the organization as the one-source of the truth.

Actively challenging contractors directly - via e.g. client cost report review meetings and by leading Time Writing Audits - and indirectly via business stakeholders.

SAP BW global MI Foundation Project: ensured that NL NAM (pilot) played a leading role in how we globally execute Project Reporting. The global foundation reports developed at that time are still embedded in the processes within our Projects.  

Played a critical role in the continuation of the offshoring program for Finance Projects by migrating activities to Chennai while ensuring consistency across our 3 business unit finance processes.
profile_positions.title: Finance Advisor Projects Onshore

profile_positions.description:
Finance Projects is the most exciting business Finance job for a finance professional! Creating new assets providing value to the business, each project with its specific risks, challenges and timelines. What is not to like about this? 

In this role I was responsible for one large project and a portfolio of projects. Investment proposal support/challenge and providing transparency in expenditure and investment choices during CAPEX review meetings. During project reviews internally and externally (with ISC/EPCM) I ensured stakeholders were held accountable for their delivery of scope, forecast vs. their Business plan- and internal/external project target settings. 

Continuous improve: initiated and coordinated the joint Finance, Project Services and Supply Chain Management improvement tracker. We improved many of our (joint) processes, data structures and leadtime/quality of deliverables (e.g. Project ONE pagers from 1week to 1day). I improved the ISC (Integrated Service Contractor) consortium contract controls and was a member of the ISC improvement project which improved quality & lead-time of contractor’s project reporting significantly.

SSC Migrations: we migrated a high% of Project Finance activities to our Finance Operation Shared Service Centre in Chennai. Globally our collaboration was seen as best practice.

During this assignment I was also asked for the Shell Upstream Europe Cost Ambition project as a team member: targeting Upstream Europe OPEX saving of USD 0.3Bln. 

Shell Gabon short-term assignment: leading the roll out of the Cost Transparency programme, improving their Project Governance & Appraisal process and data/report structures setups. Prime focus was to upskill and share knowledge with Finance and non-Finance staff but in parallel impact was made on e.g. working capital levels.
profile_positions.title: Project Accountant Offshore

profile_positions.description:
My first role in the energy sector – still excited about this sector and its importance for society. In this role I was responsible for internal and external reporting: e.g. Business Performance Reviews, Joint Venture partner reporting, Shell benchmark input, environmental reporting and monthly consolidation of Shell Upstream Europe OPEX.

Business Plan modelling: development of OPEX long term planning model resulting in a more efficient and robust budgeting process and more important; more realistic economic cut offs by evacuation system.

Participated in and provided financials for several “producing the limit” workshops with external Oil & Gas companies - which resulted in the asset de-complexing strategy change.

Project member of SAP Business Warehouse deployment project for Europe: key player in defining the SAP BW reports which are still used globally. Deployed within NAM, UK and NOV Italy.

Implemented several SAP Blueprint functional/master data improvements improving Maintenance reporting, improving the quality of billing statements to our Joint Venture partners, enabling the business to manage their P&L per evacuation system which improved value prioritizing discussions until this day.

Initiated Europe wide cleanup of the global cost chart of account hierarchies: first steps in defining a fit for purpose global standard.
